'''Jana Rae Kramer'''<ref name=tvguide>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/jana-kramer/bio/302744/ |title=Jana Kramer |publisher=[[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]] |access-date=December 14, 2016 |archive-date=December 22, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161222052130/http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/jana-kramer/bio/302744/ |url-status=dead}}</ref> (born December 2, 1983)<ref name=allmusic>{{cite web| url= http://www.allmusic.com/artist/jana-kramer-mn0002701931/biography | title= Jana Kramer Biography| first=Steve|last= Leggett|publisher=[[AllMusic.com]]| access-date= December 14, 2016| archive-date=March 12, 2016 | archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20160312202117/http://www.allmusic.com/artist/jana-kramer-mn0002701931/biography |url-status=live}} Gives birthplace as Detroit, Michigan, of which Rochester Hills is a suburb.</ref> is an American [[country music|country]] singer and actress.  She is known for her role as [[Alex Dupre]] on the television series ''[[One Tree Hill (TV series)|One Tree Hill]]''.

Kramer began her musical career in 2012 and has released two albums: ''[[Jana Kramer (album)|Jana Kramer]]'' (2012) and ''[[Thirty One (Jana Kramer album)|Thirty One]]'' (2015). The albums produced seven charted singles on [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]], including the top 10 hits "[[Why Ya Wanna]]" and "[[I Got the Boy]]". She competed on [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 23)|season 23]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'', finishing in fourth place.

==Early life==
Jana Rae Kramer was born on December 2, 1983 in [[Rochester Hills, Michigan]]<ref name="allmusic" /> to Nora and Martin Kramer,<ref name="tvguide" /> who are of German descent.{{Citation needed|date=February 2024}} She has an elder brother, Steve, who is a sergeant at the [[Oakland County Sheriff's Office]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Edwards |first1=Tara |title=Dancing With The Stars' Jana Kramer's brother to compete in local dance competition |url=https://www.wxyz.com/news/dancing-with-the-stars-jana-kramers-brother-to-compete-in-local-dance-competition |website=WXYZ Detroit |date=November 7, 2016 |publisher=Scripps Local Media |access-date=May 3, 2021}}</ref> She speaks some German.<ref name="german">{{cite web|url=http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2012/05/30/new-artist-spotlight-jana-kramer|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120604070403/http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2012/05/30/new-artist-spotlight-jana-kramer/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 4, 2012|title=New Artist Spotlight: Jana Kramer|work=Great American County|access-date=June 4, 2012}}</ref> Kramer lived in [[Dearborn, Michigan|Dearborn]] for some time after her parents divorced.{{Citation needed|date=February 2024}} She attended [[Rochester Adams High School]], where she graduated in 2002. Kramer subsequently moved to Los Angeles to pursue an acting career. She later moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]].<ref name="highschool">{{cite news|last=Crawfis|first=Jesse|title=Actress, Country Music Star Returns To Her Hometown With Video|url=http://www.theoaklandpress.com/articles/2012/02/28/entertainment/doc4f4c009c599e2163362962.txt?viewmode=default|access-date=February 28, 2012|newspaper=[[Oakland Press]] |location=Oakland County, Michigan |date=February 28, 2012| archive-date=March 6, 2016 | archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20160306015653/http://www.theoaklandpress.com/general-news/20120228/actress-country-music-star-returns-to-her-hometown-with-video?viewmode=default |url-status=dead}}</ref>

==Career==
===2002–2011: Acting career and record deal===
In 2002, Kramer made her acting debut in the low-budget independent [[horror film]] ''Dead/Undead''. The following year Kramer guest appeared on ''[[All My Children]]'', which marked Kramer's television debut. Kramer has since continued to appear in a number of television shows such as ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation]]'', ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'', ''[[Private Practice (TV series)|Private Practice]]'' and ''[[CSI: NY]]''. She has also had small supporting roles in films such as ''[[Return of the Living Dead: Necropolis]]'', ''[[Click (2006 film)|Click]]'', ''[[Prom Night (2008 film)|Prom Night]]'', ''Heart of the Country'', and ''Country Crush''. She was also in ''Spring Breakdown''.

In 2007, Kramer appeared in a recurring role on the [[NBC]] sports drama television series ''[[Friday Night Lights (TV series)|Friday Night Lights]]''. She played the role of Noelle Davenport in the series' second season. In 2008, Kramer appeared in [[The CW]] teen drama series ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'', a reboot of the 1990s teen drama television series ''[[Beverly Hills 90210]]''. Kramer played the role of high school student Portia Ranson and made her debut in the first season's second episode "The Jet Set". Her role went on for six episodes and Kramer made her final appearance in "The Party's Over", which aired May 5, 2009. In 2009, Kramer appeared on the [[HBO]] dramedy television series ''[[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|Entourage]]''. Kramer played the role of a sorority girl who seduces the character Turtle ([[Jerry Ferrara]]), and appeared in four episodes.

In June 2009, it was announced Kramer would star in the CW drama television series seventh season of ''[[One Tree Hill (TV series)|One Tree Hill]]''. Kramer played the role of Alex Dupre, an actress and tabloid darling who becomes the new face of [[Brooke Davis (One Tree Hill)|Brooke Davis]]'s fashion line, "Clothes Over Bros", and creates havoc for the residents of Tree Hill. Kramer made her debut in the season's first episode. Initially Kramer's appearance on the show was meant to be in a recurring form, but her role was upgraded to a series regular by the season's fourteenth episode, "Family Affair". In March 2012, Kramer made the announcement that she would no longer be making regular appearances in the show's ninth and final season, as she decided to focus on her music career. Her last appearance on the show occurred in the second episode of the ninth season, "In the Room Where You Sleep," which was aired on January 18, 2012.<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Chuck |last=Dauphin |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-615/499411/spotlight-jana-kramer-gave-up-one-tree-hill-for-music-dreams |title=Spotlight: Jana Kramer Gave Up 'One Tree Hill' for Music Dreams |magazine=Billboard |date=March 21, 2012 |access-date=December 18, 2013}}</ref>

In February 2011, Kramer signed a recording contract with [[Elektra Records]]. That same month she premiered her promo track, "I Won't Give Up", which premiered in the ''One Tree Hill'' episode, "Holding Out for a Hero", and was released the following day exclusively on [[iTunes]] and [[Amazon.com|Amazon]]. The song reached number 75 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] chart. The following month Kramer began work on her debut album. Country music producer [[Scott Hendricks]] produced the majority of the record. In April 2011, Kramer released another promo track, titled "[[Whiskey (Jana Kramer song)|Whiskey]]", which she also performed on ''One Tree Hill''. The song reached number 99 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 chart on digital sales alone.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hollywoodcrush.mtv.com/2011/02/04/jana-kramer-record-deal/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110206040449/http://hollywoodcrush.mtv.com/2011/02/04/jana-kramer-record-deal/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=February 6, 2011 |title=Jana Kramer Signs Record Deal, Will Debut Single On "One Tree Hill" |publisher=MTV |date=February 4, 2011 |access-date=December 18, 2013}}</ref>

===2012–2018: ''Jana Kramer,'' and ''Dancing with the Stars''===
In February 2012, Kramer was cast as the [[protagonist]] in the independent drama film, ''Heart of the Country'', playing the role of a privileged young woman, Faith Carraday,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://heartofthecountrymovie.com/|title=利尻ヘアカラートリートメントを週1回使用すれば白髪なし＆髪はツヤツヤになる！|publisher=HeartOfTheCountry.com}}</ref> who is following her show-biz dreams but leaves it all and moves to rural North Carolina after her husband is jailed for Wall Street fraud. Kramer is also attached to a horror film named ''The Gatekeeper''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://wae.blogs.starnewsonline.com/23487/jana-kramer-to-play-lead-role-in-heart-of-the-country/ |title=Jana Kramer of 'One Tree Hill' to play lead role in 'Heart of the Country' |publisher=The WAE |date=February 22, 2012 |access-date=December 18, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131219105006/http://wae.blogs.starnewsonline.com/23487/jana-kramer-to-play-lead-role-in-heart-of-the-country/ |archive-date=December 19, 2013 |url-status=dead }}</ref>

[[File:Jana Kramer 2019 by Glenn Francis.jpg|right|thumb|Jana Kramer at the 2019 iHeartRadio Music Awards in Los Angeles.]]
On January 16, 2012, Kramer released her official debut single, "[[Why Ya Wanna]]". Kramer premiered the official music video, directed by Kristin Barlowe, on February 6, 2012. The song peaked at number 52 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart and number 3 on the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart. "Whiskey" is the album's second official single. On June 1, 2012, Kramer made her first televised live performance on ''[[Fox & Friends]]'' to promote her debut album. She performed "Why Ya Wanna" in front of a crowd of fans in [[New York City]]. On June 5, 2012, Kramer released her self-titled debut album ''[[Jana Kramer (album)|Jana Kramer]]''. The record received positive reviews from critics with many praising Kramer's vocal performance.

On June 5, 2013, [[Nationwide Insurance]] released the first of a series of commercials in its "Join the Nation" campaign, featuring Kramer as a stealthy woman dressed in black leather who follows a team of [[Burglary|burglars]] and replaces the items they steal with newer versions to promote Nationwide's "Brand New Belongings" initiative.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.nationwide.com/brand-new-belongings-commercial/ |title=Jana Kramer Stars in New Nationwide Ad |publisher=Nationwide Blog |date=June 5, 2013 |access-date=May 17, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140518025553/http://blog.nationwide.com/brand-new-belongings-commercial/ |archive-date=May 18, 2014}}</ref> Nationwide had signed Kramer to sing the Nationwide [[jingle]] in August 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.janakramer.com/news/jana-kramer-signed-sing-nationwide-insurance's- |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170122192906/http://www.janakramer.com/news/jana-kramer-signed-sing-nationwide-insurance's- |url-status=dead |archive-date=January 22, 2017 |title=Jana Kramer Signed to Sing Nationwide's 'On Your Side' Jingle |publisher=JanaKramer.com |date=August 10, 2012 |access-date=May 17, 2014 }}</ref> A second commercial, released in April 2014, featured Kramer's character replacing items in a fire-blackened apartment to promote Nationwide's [[renters' insurance]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.artistdirect.com/entertainment-news/article/watch-jana-kramer-s-sexy-as-usual-new-nationwide-tv-spot/10917112 |title=Watch Jana Kramer's Sexy-as-Usual New Nationwide TV Spot |publisher=ArtistDirect.com |date=April 10, 2014 |access-date=May 17, 2014 |archive-date=September 2, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902113106/http://www.artistdirect.com/entertainment-news/article/watch-jana-kramer-s-sexy-as-usual-new-nationwide-tv-spot/10917112 |url-status=dead }}</ref> In November 2014, Jana reprised her Nationwide role, this time as a sexy Santa Claus-like figure replacing items during Christmas season. Nationwide's advertising partner [[McKinney (advertising agency)|McKinney]] is behind the spots.<ref>{{cite web|title=Work for Nationwide|url=http://mckinney.com/work/clients/nationwide|publisher=McKinney.com|access-date=December 29, 2014}}</ref>

In July 2013, Kramer opened for [[Blake Shelton]] on his [[Ten Times Crazier Tour]] in Virginia Beach, VA.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theboot.com/2013/01/17/blake-shelton-tour-dates-2013/ |title=Blake Shelton Tour Dates 2013 Will Be 'Ten Times Crazier' |publisher=Theboot.com |date=January 17, 2013 |access-date=December 18, 2013}}</ref> In August 2013, the independent film ''[[Approaching Midnight]]'' starring Kramer had its world premiere at the Emagine Royal Oak in Michigan.<ref name="Oakland Press">{{cite web|url=http://www.theoaklandpress.com/20130826/independent-michigan-film-approaching-midnight-premieres-in-royal-oak|title=Independent Michigan film 'Approaching Midnight' premieres in Royal Oak|work=The Oakland Press|date=September 9, 2013|access-date=September 17, 2013|archive-date=October 4, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004215000/http://www.theoaklandpress.com/20130826/independent-michigan-film-approaching-midnight-premieres-in-royal-oak|url-status=dead}}</ref>

In 2024, Jana Kramer starred in the [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]] movie ''[[Gaslit By My Husband: The Morgan Metzer Story]]'' as Morgan Metzer where she was also the executive producer. It is based on the true story on how Morgan was gaslit by her ex-husband Rodney Metzer (portrayed by [[Austin Nichols]]).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.today.com/popculture/movies/gaslit-by-my-husband-true-story-rcna155390|title=The true story behind the Lifetime movie 'Gaslit By My Husband', according to Morgan Metzer herself|website=Today|first=Lindsay|last=Lowe|date=June 9, 2024|access-date=June 9, 2024}}</ref>

==Personal life==
Kramer married Michael Gambino in 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/603389/jana-kramer-is-engaged-to-michael-caussin| title=Jana Kramer Is Engaged to Michael Caussin!|publisher=[[E! News]]|first=Zach|last= Johnson|date=December 4, 2014 |access-date=April 17, 2019}}</ref> They divorced several months later, after Kramer suffered severe domestic abuse that led to Gambino's 2005 conviction on [[homicide|attempted murder]] charges.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/tv/jana-kramer-abusive-first-husband-tried-to-kill-me/|title=Jana Kramer's Shocking Secret: My First Husband Tried to Kill Me|first=Elizabeth|last=Leonard|date=July 18, 2017|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|language=en|access-date=April 17, 2019}}</ref> On December 22, 2009, Kramer became engaged to actor [[Johnathon Schaech]], whom she had met on the set of ''[[Prom Night (2008 film)|Prom Night]]''. They married on July 4, 2010, in Michigan. The couple separated a month later.<ref name="e2010">{{cite web |url= http://ca.eonline.com/news/194528/one-tree-hill-actress-s-marriage-over-after-a-month|date= August 9, 2010 |title=One Tree Hill Actress's Marriage Over After a Month |access-date=September 8, 2013|first=Natalie|last=Finn |publisher=[[E! News]]}}</ref> Their divorce was finalized in June 2011.<ref name="us2011">{{cite web |url= http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jana-rae-kramer-and-johnathon-schaech-divorce-201186|date= June 8, 2011 |title=One Tree Hill's Jana Rae Kramer Finalizes Divorce|access-date=September 8, 2013|work=Us Weekly}}</ref> Kramer met [[country music]] singer [[Brantley Gilbert]] in June 2012 [[CMT Music Awards]]. They later began dating and became engaged on January 20, 2013, his 28th birthday,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/brantley-gilbert-jana-kramer-dating/|title=Brantley Gilbert Confirms That He and Jana Kramer Are Dating |last=Dukes |first=Billy| date=September 21, 2012|publisher=Taste of Country|access-date=September 23, 2012}}</ref> but ended their relationship in August 2013.<ref>{{cite web|last=Takeda |first=Allison |url= http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jana-kramer-fiance-brantley-gilbert-split-2013158 |title=Jana Kramer Split: Singer, Fiance Brantley Gilbert Call Off Engagement |work=Us Weekly |date=August 15, 2013 |access-date=December 18, 2013}}</ref>

In August 2014, Kramer began dating [[Washington Commanders|Washington Redskins]] tight end [[Mike Caussin]], whom she met on Twitter.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1752987/jana-kramer-wedding-date-and-tour-dates/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150413032337/http://www.cmt.com/news/1752987/jana-kramer-wedding-date-and-tour-dates/|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 13, 2015|title=Jana Kramer Wedding|access-date=August 12, 2015|publisher=CMT News|date=April 9, 2015}}</ref> She announced just weeks later that they had split because of his infidelity.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nashvillegab.com/2014/08/jana-kramer-is-single-again.html|title=Jana Kramer is single again|publisher=NashvilleGab|date=August 25, 2014|access-date=August 25, 2016|archive-date=August 9, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200809061935/https://nashvillegab.com/2014/08/jana-kramer-is-single-again.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> Shortly after, she publicly forgave him and they reconciled. Kramer and Caussin became engaged in December 2014 on her 31st birthday,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Shelburn|first1=Craig|title=Jana Kramer Engaged to Michael Caussin |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1746273/jana-kramer-engaged-to-michael-caussin/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141214191837/http://www.cmt.com/news/1746273/jana-kramer-engaged-to-michael-caussin/|url-status=dead|archive-date=December 14, 2014|access-date=December 29, 2014|publisher=CMT News|date=December 3, 2014}}</ref> and were married on May 22, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|last=Webber |first=Stephanie |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jana-kramer-marries-michael-caussin-we-feel-extremely-blessed-2015225 |title=Jana Kramer Marries Michael Caussin: "We Feel Extremely Blessed" |work=Us Weekly |date=May 22, 2015 |access-date=August 10, 2015}}</ref>

On August 10, 2015, the couple revealed they were expecting their first child.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://celebritybabies.people.com/2015/08/10/jana-kramer-pregnant-expecting-first-child-michael-caussin/ |title=Jana Kramer Pregnant; Expecting First Child with Michael Caussin – Moms & Babies – Celebrity Babies and Kids - Moms & Babies - People.com |access-date=August 10, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150811110853/http://celebritybabies.people.com/2015/08/10/jana-kramer-pregnant-expecting-first-child-michael-caussin/ |archive-date=August 11, 2015 |url-status=dead }}</ref> Kramer gave birth to her daughter on January 31, 2016.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Murray|first1=Rheana |title=Singer Jana Kramer shares first photo of adorable baby girl |url=http://www.today.com/parents/singer-jana-kramer-shares-first-photo-adorable-baby-girl-jolie-t70501?cid=sm_fb_klg |work=[[Today (US TV program)|Today]]|publisher=NBC|date=February 1, 2016}}</ref> Husband Mike Caussin as He Enters Rehab|url=http://www.people.com/article/jana-kramer-separates-mike-caussin|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 24, 2016}}</ref> They reconciled the following year and renewed their wedding vows in December 2017.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Pasquini|first1=Maria|title=Jana Kramer and Husband Mike Caussin Renew Their Vows After addiction.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://people.com/country/jana-kramer-supports-husband-mike-caussin-sex-addiction/|title=Jana Kramer Supports Husband Mike Caussin After He Opens Up About Sex Addiction: 'We Got Your Back'|magazine=People|language=en|access-date=April 17, 2019}}</ref> In July of that year, Kramer announced she was expecting her second child.<ref>{{Cite November 29, 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/Bqx8cIqljtm/|first=Jana|last=Kramer|title=Welcome to the world, Jace Joseph Caussin|publisher=Jana Kramer verified Instagram account|date=November 29, 2018}}</ref>

On April 20, 2021, Kramer filed for divorce from Caussin, citing "inappropriate marital conduct, irreconcilable differences and adultery". Two days after the pair split, a temporary restraining order was issued.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Hearon |first1=Sarah |title=Jana Kramer and Mike Caussin's Divorce Includes Restraining Order: Details |url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jana-kramer-mike-caussin-granted-restraining-order-amid-divorce/ |website=Us Weekly |date=April 27, 2021 |publisher=A360 Media Entertainment Group |access-date=May 4, 2021}}</ref> On May 20, 2021, it was reported that Kramer and Caussin reached an agreement with custody and child support. Kramer was awarded primary custody, according to the documents.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Nardino |first1=Meredith |title=Jana Kramer and Mike Caussin's Custody Arrangement and Child Support Agreement Revealed Amid Divorce |url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jana-kramer-mike-caussin-plan-custody-child-support-amid-split/ |website=Us Weekly |date=May 20, 2021 |publisher=A360 Media Entertainment Group |access-date=25 June 2021}}</ref> The divorce was finalized on July 22, 2021.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Campione |first1=Katie |title=Jana Kramer Finalizes Divorce from Mike Caussin: 'It's Just the Beginning of My Story' |url=https://people.com/country/jana-kramer-mike-caussin-finalize-divorce/ |website=People.com |publisher=Meredith Corporation |access-date=1 August 2021}}</ref>

From September 2021 to October 2021, Kramer dated former [[Chicago Bears]] quarterback [[Jay Cutler]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Contreras |first1=Cydney |title=Why Jay Cutler "Broke It Off" With Jana Kramer After Brief Romance |url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1305065/why-jay-cutler-broke-it-off-with-jana-kramer-after-brief-romance |website=E! News |date=October 6, 2021 |publisher=NBCUniversal |access-date=11 January 2022}}</ref> From late 2021 to April 2022, Kramer dated fitness trainer and Navy veteran Ian Schinelli.<ref>{{cite web |last1=DeSantis |first1=Rachel |title=Jana Kramer Reveals New Boyfriend Ian Schinelli on Instagram: 'Really Nice to Find Happiness' |url=https://people.com/country/jana-kramer-reveals-new-boyfriend-ian-schinelli-on-instagram/ |website=People.com |publisher=Meredith Corporation |access-date=11 January 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Shilliday |first1=Beth |title=Who Is Jana Kramer's Boyfriend? Get to Know Her Hunky Personal Trainer Ian Schinelli After Mike Caussin Divorce |url=https://www.lifeandstylemag.com/posts/who-is-jana-kramers-boyfriend-ian-schinelli-meet-personal-trainer/ |website=Life & Style |date=January 11, 2022 |publisher=A360 Media Entertainment Group. |access-date=11 January 2022}}</ref>

In January 2023, Kramer publicly confirmed via Instagram her relationship with [[Allan Russell]], a former Scottish soccer player who created Superior Striker, a coaching program. On May 25, 2023, it was confirmed the two were engaged after six months of dating.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=DeSantis|first=Rachel|title= Jana Kramer Is Engaged to Allan Russell After 6 Months of Dating: 'I Know He's My Person'|url=https://people.com/jana-kramer-engaged-allan-russell-after-six-months-of-dating-7504261|date=May 25, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|magazine=People!}}</ref> On June 8, 2023, the couple confirmed via Instagram that they are expecting their first child together.<ref>{{cite news|last=Carras|first=Christi|title= Jana Kramer expecting first child with fiancé Allan Russell: 'It's been hard to hide'|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/music/story/2023-06-08/jana-kramer-pregnant-baby-fiance-allan-russell|date=June 8, 2023|access-date=July 13, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230713081850/https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/music/story/2023-06-08/jana-kramer-pregnant-baby-fiance-allan-russell|archive-date=July 13, 2023|newspaper=[[The Los Angeles Times]]}}</ref> Kramer gave birth to her second son on November 13, 2023.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Instagram |url=https://www.instagram.com/p/CzpOhd0rEZR/?img_index=1 |access-date=2023-11-14 |website=www.instagram.com}}</ref> Kramer and Russell married on July 13, 2024 in Scotland. <ref>{{cite web | url=https://people.com/jana-kramer-marries-allan-russell-in-scottish-wedding-complete-with-an-airbnb-castle-kilts-and-more-exclusive-8676536 | title=Jana Kramer Marries Allan Russell in Scotland Wedding: See the Castle, Kilts and Tartan Ribbon Cake! (Exclusive) }}</ref>

==''Dancing with the Stars''==
On August 30, 2016, Kramer was announced as one of the celebrities who would compete on [[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 23)|season 23]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]''. She was partnered with professional partner [[Gleb Savchenko]]. Kramer and Savchenko reached the finals of the show and finished in 4th place.
